alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 03 at 6:31AM CDT until April 06 at 11:30AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River at Black River Falls affecting Jackson County. .With the past rain that fell on a deep primed snowpack, this resulted in the melt increasing. Flows in rivers have increased as a response and will reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River at Black River Falls. * WHEN...Until late Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 47.0 feet, Some rural roads may begin to flood including county Highway VV downstream near the La Crosse County line. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 47.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 AM CDT Monday was 49.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 48.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 47.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 48.8 feet on 04/12/2002. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM CDT.
